definition: to chant/to recite rhythmically/to polish verse
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)

sentences.english: On grey mornings of rain I have crooned many an idle song.
sentences.chinese: 在灰暗的雨天的早晨，我吟哦过许多飘逸的诗篇。

definition: to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to talk in one's sleep/crazy talk
sinuous/meandering/to take a circuitous route/to toss about/vicissitudes/variant of 婉轉|婉转[wan3 zhuan3]
looking up expectantly/speaking softly (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [yu2 yu2])
